channel.title: ProxySQL Monitoring on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes
channel.description: Recent content in ProxySQL Monitoring on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes

item.title: Monitor ProxySQL using Builtin Prometheus Discovery
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. This is an Enterprise-only feature. Please install KubeDB Enterprise Edition to try this feature. Monitoring ProxySQL with builtin Prometheus This tutorial will show you how to monitor ProxySQL using builtin Prometheus scraper. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster. If you do not already have a cluster, you can create one by using kind.

item.title: Monitor ProxySQL using Prometheus Operator
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. This is an Enterprise-only feature. Please install KubeDB Enterprise Edition to try this feature. Monitoring ProxySQL Using Prometheus operator Prometheus operator provides simple and Kubernetes native ways to deploy and configure the Prometheus server. This tutorial will show you how to use the Prometheus operator to monitor ProxySQL deployed with KubeDB. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster.

item.title: ProxySQL Monitoring Overview
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. This is an Enterprise-only feature. Please install KubeDB Enterprise Edition to try this feature. Monitoring ProxySQL with KubeDB KubeDB has native support for monitoring via Prometheus. You can use builtin Prometheus scraper or Prometheus operator to monitor KubeDB managed databases. This tutorial will show you how database monitoring works with KubeDB and how to configure Database crd to enable monitoring.
